alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 10:40PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR THE LITTLE COLORADO RIVER FROM WOODRUFF TO JOSEPH CITY UNTIL 830 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Little Colorado River from Woodruff to Joseph City. * WHEN...Until 830 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...River flows are elevated. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 PM MST, stream gauge reports indicated a 7 foot rise in water levels along the Little Colorado River near Woodruff this afternoon and evening. River levels have just begun to rise in Holbrook and will continue downstream to Joseph City through Thursday morning. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Little Colorado River and Silver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Holbrook, Woodruff, Joseph City and Manila. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 268 and 276...and between mile markers 280 and 287. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 275 and 287. State Route 77 between mile markers 387 and 388. Highway 180 between mile markers 308 and 312. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of rivers are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
